basics.name: Piyush Ajmani
basics.label: AWS Certified Developer | Software Engineer at Cuenca | Online Instructor
basics.headline: Passionate about solving complex problems and designing systems leveraging my skills in Computer Programming.
basics.summary:
A Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, AWS Certification for Developer Associate and hands-on experience creating, implementing and scaling software applications. I enjoy being challenged and engaging with projects that require me to work outside my comfort and knowledge set, as continuing to learn new languages and development techniques are important to me. A few more points that I would like to highlight that would enable me to contribute to your bottom line are:
 
- Highly skilled in designing, testing, and developing software 
- Thorough understanding of data structures and algorithms 
- Knowledgeable of AWS best practices 
- Hands-on software troubleshooting experience 
- Proven track record of proper documentation for future maintenance and upgrades

projects.name: Zipper
projects.summary: Huffman Compressor for lossless compression.  Compress 1MB txt file to 600KB in 1.5s.  Decompress in 1.8s

projects.name: Snippets
projects.summary: Cross platform desktop app made in Electron.js to keep code snippets together.  Shortcuts for quick access, sorting and searching through the snippets.  Syntax highlighting by ace editor.

work.summary: Technologies: AWS Lambda, Elasticsearch, SNS, ELB, Client VPN, EC2, IAM, DynamoDB, Flask, Python
highlights: Infrastructure: Moved logs from all the services to a central ELK cluster hosted on AWS. Improved communication b/w microservices using SNS.
Security: Secured the internal customer service tool by a VPN only access. Refined IAM roles and policies with the principle of least privilege.
OCR Project: Used google vision and python to analyse documents to validate identity of users.

work.summary: Technologies  : AWS, PHP, JavaScript, Docker, SQL
highlights: Full Stack Development: Developed new features and solved bugs for a hybrid desktop - mobile payments app.
Infrastructure: Scaled the app for 30K+ daily transactions. Designed systems and databases for new features.
Java Instructor: Instructor for a course in Data Structures and Algorithms in Java. Reviews.
Online Courses: Published an online course on "How to Build Desktop Apps with Electron" on Udemy and Coding Blocks Online.
Android App: Published an android app to shorten URLs directly from the context menu of the keyboard. Consumed the open source API built at the company. Github
Android App with AWS backend: Made an android app for lab inventory management using AWS Lambda, RDS, API Gateway, Cognito.
Firmware Testing: Fixed various issues to qualify SSD for chromebox by completing a 15 day test suite which only ran for 4 days earlier.
OCR Project: Used OpenCV and Python to evaluate OMR answer sheets.
Full Stack Development: Built an interactive web platform for teachers to evaluate students' performance and statistics.

education.activities: Student Lead at Developer Student Club, which is a Google Developers Program for university students to help build mobile and web development skills and knowledge.

other.summary: Tutoring high school and university students from USA (on Skype) on Java programming, Object Oriented Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Android and Web Development.
